content.description: The following questions refer to an experiment that is set up to determine the relative volume of O2 consumed by germinating and nongerminating (dry) pea seeds at two different temperatures. The change in volume is detected by using a respirometer over a given period of time. The data are given below.
content.question: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the data?

choices.label: Nongerminating pea seeds have a higher rate of respiration than germinating pea seeds do.
Light is required for pea seed germination.
In the nongerminating pea seeds, oxygen consumption is directly proportional to oxygen concentration.
Less carbon dioxide is produced by germinating pea seeds at 26ºC than at 10ºC.
In pea seeds an increase in temperature results in an increase in oxygen consumption.

content.answer: In pea seeds an increase in temperature results in an increase in oxygen consumption.
